newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bonds flat, quiet on U.S. mkt closure.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bonds flat, quiet on U.S. mkt closure.

text.p: Argentine bonds were virtually untraded Friday as the market stuck to very narrow ranges ahead of the early closure of the U.S. market.
"There is very little movement," said a trader at a foreign bank.
With the U.S. Treasuries market closing early Friday ahead of a holiday Monday traders did not expect much action locally until Tuesday.
Argentina's FRB Brady bond due 2005 was up 1/8 at 93-1/8, while no prices on local bonds were quoted on screens.
The dollar-denominated Bocon Previsional 2 due 2001 rose $0.03 to 122.83 Thursday.
"The market is just range-trading, waiting for next week," said another trader.
